title: Cal-fouri, a lesser-spotted law & Russell v the Shed - Prem talking points
description: Noah Caluori's teenage kicks continue as Finn Russell asks for quiet and Tommy Freeman and Henry Pollock benefit from an obscure corner of the law book.

title: 'Another unbelievable result' - but what's different about Man Utd now?
description: MOTD pundit Danny Murphy explains how Manchester United earned their impressive win at Premier League leaders Arsenal, and how he feels the Gunners will react.

title: Why Arsenal's wobble may not even matter - despite 'feeling pressure'
description: Arsenal's winless run may normally be cause for concern - but the stats suggest they are still in control of the Premier League title race.

title: Grudge match or homecoming - what next for Pimblett?
description: Paddy Pimblett is not short of options for his return to fighting despite his loss to Justin Gaethje at UFC 324.

title: Surviving bombs and hunger to become a professional tennis player
description: Tennis is seen as a rich sport. But many stars, including Novak Djokovic and Elina Svitolina, have forged successful careers from humble beginnings.

title: Rejections, depression & promise to his mum - Thiago's route to top
description: Igor Thiago's route to the Premier League has been far from straightforward - BBC Sport charts the rise of Brentford's record-breaking Brazilian striker.

title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
description: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
description: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
description: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
description: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.
